channel.title: Kramer Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Kramer Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: Community Resources and Upcoming School Events
item.description:
Community Resources: PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. Additional community events include the Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro Oxford, grades 3-6, Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), English Language Café at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and Petermann Transportation hiring bus drivers (must be 21+, starting pay $20/hr, call 513-273-3150).

Upcoming School Events: Key dates include PTG meetings, grade-level music concerts, K-Kids meetings, winter break (12/22-1/6), Mother/Son Dance, spring break (3/30-4/6), Field Day (5/8), and last day of school (5/21).

PTG Meeting (Virtual)

item.title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled & Community Updates
item.description:
The November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM (virtual meeting) to allow members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th. Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club is collecting used eyeglasses and cases (donations due early December to Betsy Beaton or Shaunna Tafelski), Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders begins September 24th with the first reward day, and families are encouraged to link Kroger Rewards cards to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

Kramer PTG Meeting (Rescheduled)

item.title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources Available
item.description:
The Kramer Free Pantry located at the entrance of Kramer is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take what they need, and donations can be dropped off at the Kramer office. For questions, donations, or additional family needs, contact Chelsea Pike, Kramer Social Worker at 513-273-3511 or pikec@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Thanksgiving Break and PAX Leaders
item.description:
Kramer Elementary wishes families a Happy Thanksgiving! Students are off for Thanksgiving break and return Monday, December 1st.

This week's Kramer PAX Leaders (Good Behavior Game) are: - KG: Otis Cherry, An'an Dong, Shep Kleibscheidel, Sophia Smith - 1st: Bryce Richardson, Vivienne Smiley, Dylan Wyatt - 2nd: Finley Peterson, Theo Siambekos - 3rd: Benjen Bufler, Ava Oppliger, Caleb Wiseman, Alicia Zheng - 4th: Nevaeh Hubbard, Gavin McCall, Aaliyah Pernell, Bentley Ramey - 5th: Gavin boling, Eden Chen, Elliot Ream, Sophia Webb

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Student Thanksgiving Turkey Art Display
item.description:
A large collaborative turkey decoration is displayed in the school, featuring a brown paper body with googly eyes and yellow beak and feet. The turkey's tail feathers consist of hundreds of colorful, hand-decorated paper feathers created by students, each filled with drawings, patterns, and writing, spreading across the wall in a vibrant display of student creativity for the Thanksgiving season.

View original newsletter

item.title: Community Events and School Calendar
item.description:
The Community Page features local resources and upcoming school events. PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants for home repairs to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District—call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. The calendar includes key dates through May, such as Thanksgiving Break (Nov 24-28), Winter Break (Dec 22-Jan 6), Spring Break (March 30-April 6), and various K-Kids meetings, music concerts, and family events like the Mother/Son Dance and Field Day.

Additional community opportunities include a shoe donation drive for 4Paws for Ability (collection until December 1st, accepting all styles/sizes), Cincinnati Youth Choir's Vivo Coro Oxford for grades 3-6 (Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), English Language Café at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and bus driver positions with Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting pay, call 513-273-3150).

K-Kids Meeting

item.title: Weekly PAX Leaders Highlighted at Kramer
item.description:
Kramer Elementary begins a new weekly feature highlighting PAX classroom leaders. This week's leaders include: - KG: Amelia Chen, Lorelai Dougherty, Hannah Neim, Josue Perez Gomes - 1st Grade: Caroline Butler, Cora King, Hunter Stewart, Oscar Villanueva-Fuentes - 2nd Grade: Charles Hricko, Lucy Ransdell, Avery Reece, Aiden Todd - 3rd Grade: Kendall Gloyeske, Lucian Miller, Keyla Perez Gomez, Audrey Ream - 4th Grade: Abby Bulanda, Luke Hricko, Liam Morrow, Levi Smith - 5th Grade: Sonia Clark, Alyssa Martinez

Thanksgiving break is November 24-28. Other upcoming events include no school on November 4 (voting day), 3rd Grade STEM day at Miami on November 7, 4th Grade Music Concert on November 12 at 7:00, Class @ the Court for grades 3-5 on November 13 (PTG Dine to Donate at Logrosa's), and report cards sent home November 14.

item.description:
This is a date header for Friday, November 14, 2025. No specific events, announcements, or information are included in this newsletter item.

item.title: Holiday Adopt-a-Family Program for Kramer Students
item.description:
Support Kramer Elementary families this holiday season by purchasing gifts from their Amazon Wishlist. Every gift goes directly to a Kramer student or family in need of extra support. For questions or if your family needs holiday assistance, contact Chelsea Pike at pikec@talawanda.org. Shop the wishlist here.

View original newsletter

item.title: Weekly Update and Report Card Distribution
item.description:
Week recap for Kramer with important reminders: Colder temperatures are expected next week, so students should dress warmly. Report cards will be distributed on Friday, November 14th.

item.title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
item.description:
The November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th from 6-7:30 PM in the THS auditorium. Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases (donations to Betsy Beaton or Shaunna Tafelski by early December), Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) program starting September 24th for K-2nd graders, and a reminder to connect Kroger Rewards cards to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

item.title: Kramer Free Pantry and Food Resources
item.description:
The Kramer Free Pantry at the entrance of Kramer is stocked with food and hygiene items including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes—available to all students and families in need. Contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 or pikec@talawanda.org for questions, donations, or to learn about other Talawanda food resources. Donations can be dropped off at the Kramer office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer
item.description:
Unplug & Play Kramer - Flashlight Fun at Dusk on Wednesday, November 5, 5:30-7:00 PM at Kramer playground. Bring a lawn chair and relax while kids engage in independent creative play with flashlights. Parents and staff can chat while children play unplugged.

Additional updates: Kramer PTG Meeting on Tuesday, December 2 at 7 PM (virtual - parents and teachers encouraged to attend); LaRosa's Pizza Fundraiser on Thursday, November 13, 4 PM-close (dine in, delivery, pickup - lunch delivery included, must note Kramer on receipt); Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders begins Wednesday, September 24th; Kroger Community Rewards - link your card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

Unplug & Play Kramer - Flashlight Fun at Dusk

item.title: Halloween Celebration and Lost and Found
item.description:
Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween with class parties and a costume parade. No school on Tuesday, November 4th for Election Day. The school has accumulated a large lost and found collection - parents should check the office or photos to claim items. All unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break (November 24-28). Thank you to parent volunteers who helped with celebrations.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

item.title: Community Events and Upcoming School Calendar
item.description:
This page highlights community resources and upcoming school events. Key community offerings include: - PUSH provides home repair grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District (call 513-523-8100) - Veterans Day Breakfast & Assembly on November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (7:30 AM breakfast, 9:00 AM assembly) - RSVP to croucherk@talawanda.org - Shoe donation drive through December 1st benefiting 4Paws for Ability - Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro) meets Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University for grades 3-6 - English Language Café at Miami University, Tuesdays 6-7 PM in MacMillan Hall Room 017 - Bus driver positions available with Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting pay)

The calendar includes numerous school events through May, including trimester endings, concerts, conferences, and special events.

item.title: November Lunch Menu Available
item.description:
The November 2025 lunch menu for Kramer Elementary is now available. The menu includes daily meal options with a choice of milk included with every lunch. Notable menu items include: - November 3-7: Fish Sandwich, Beef Pretzel Dog, National Nacho Day (Nov 6), 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza - November 10-14: Chicken Patty on Bun, Hot Breaded Mozzarella Sticks, Chicken Alfredo, Chicken Tenders Dinner Roll, Wild Mike's Cheese Bites - November 17-21: Mini Corn Dogs, Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy (Nov 18), Bosco Sticks, Galaxy Personal Pan Pizza Turkey Pepperoni, Pillsbury Cheese Pull Apart Bread - November 24-28: No school for Thanksgiving Break (Nov 24-28)

All meals include vegetables, fruits, and sides. Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

item.title: Community Events and Upcoming School Calendar
item.description:
Community Resources & Events: - PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical home repairs. Call 513-523-8100 or visit push-oxford.org - After-school foreign language programs available - Trunk or Treat event on Tuesday, Oct. 28, 6-7:30 PM (scan QR code for trunk spot registration) - Medication Disposal Day on Saturday, Oct. 25, 10 AM-2 PM at Tri Building (6025 Fairfield Road) or Walmart (5720 College Corner Pike) - Veterans Day Breakfast & Assembly on Tuesday, Nov. 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (Breakfast 7:30 AM, Assembly 9:00 AM) - RSVP to croucherk@talawanda.org - Shoe donation drive for 4Paws for Ability running now through December 1st - Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro Oxford) for grades 3-6 meets Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University - English Language Café at Miami University for all ages/levels - Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017 - Bus drivers needed - starting pay $20/hr - call 513-273-3150

Upcoming School Dates: K-Kids Cereal Drive (10/27-11/7), 4th Grade field trip (10/30), Professional Development Day - No School (11/4), End of 1st Trimester (11/7), and many more events through May.

item.title: PTG Updates: Kroger Rewards and Reading Programs
item.description:
Thank You to Conference Meal Supporters: The PTG appreciates donations and volunteers who provided conference meals for teachers and staff, with special thanks to El Potrero for their meal donation.

Read At Home (RAH) Program: This voluntary reading program for K-2nd graders began Wednesday, September 24th. Students record books read at home and turn in sheets weekly for rewards (alternating between a book and a small prize). First reward day is September 24th.

Kroger Community Rewards: Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards - Kroger will donate a percentage of your purchases to the PTG. One-time sign-up required.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Health Guidelines from Nurse Briede
item.description:
When to Keep Students Home: Students with a fever of 100°F or more must stay home until fever-free for 24 hours without medication (Tylenol/Motrin). Students with vomiting or diarrhea must be symptom-free for 24 hours before returning.

Head Lice Alert: A few cases of head lice have been reported in the building. Check your child's hair especially after sleepovers, avoid sharing brushes, wash all bedding and dry on high heat if treatment is needed. Contact Nurse Briede at briedev@talawanda.org or 513-273-3554 for assistance purchasing lice treatment or for more information.

View original newsletter

item.title: Project Reboot Program Information
item.description:
Project Reboot is a program available to students. Learn more about the program and its offerings by visiting projectreboot.school.

View original newsletter
